items.title: Python 3 compatibility
items.body:
I was wondering, is redset compatible with Python 3? I didn't see it mentioned in the docs. If it is supposed to be, I am having an issue with installing via pip in a virtualenv. I do something like:

``` bash
virtualenv -p /usr/bin/python3.4 --no-site-packages test
source test/bin/activate
pip install redset
```

Which results in:

``` bash
Downloading/unpacking redset
  Downloading redset-0.4.2.tar.gz
  Running setup.py (path:/home/user/test/build/redset/setup.py) egg_info for package redset
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 17, in <module>
      File "/home/user/test/build/redset/setup.py", line 4, in <module>
        import redset
      File "/home/user/test/build/redset/redset/__init__.py", line 13, in <module>
        import serializers
    ImportError: No module named 'serializers'
    Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<string>", line 17, in <module>

  File "/home/user/test/build/redset/setup.py", line 4, in <module>

    import redset

  File "/home/user/test/build/redset/redset/__init__.py", line 13, in <module>

    import serializers

ImportError: No module named 'serializers'
```

This doesn't happen for me with a python2.7 virtualenv. The problem can be navigated by adding "test/build/redset" to the PYTHONPATH for the install and "test/lib/python3.4/site-packages/redset" to the PYTHONPATH for use.

Any insight?
Thanks,
Jon.
